messages.title: Labour in Government means:
messages.content: World class health care, All secondary schools in Islington South being re-built, Working tax credits, flexible working, maternity/paternity leave, Freedom Pass - greater participation in law by Labour since 1999, Safer Neighbourhood police in every area

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Fighting for local services, lobbied Ministers to save Essex Road Post Office, persuaded the Health Secretary to rebuild Barts Hospital, and now fighting for Whittington's A&E.
Sponsoring the Climate Change Bill, against Trident.

mentions.otherPartyLeaderCandidate: Nick Clegg, Tories first about the formation of a minority government
mentions.tacticalSituation: The Guardian implies that most likely voters switching from Labour would put Cameron into No 10.

issues.socialWelfare: Working tax credits, flexible working, maternity/paternity leave

housing.content: Freedom Pass - greater participation in law by Labour since 1999

leaflet.personalStatement: I'm a strong and independent voice. I've been called "squeaky clean" on expenses. I believe MPs must serve their communities first.

politicalExperience.achievements: Helped over 20,000 people, arguing for more affordable Government, sponsoring the Climate Change Bill, fighting against Trident, preserving local services.

quotes.text: Nick Clegg goes public on coalition - and looks to the Conservatives. Lib Dem leader signalled that he would speak to Tories first about the formation of a minority government
A Conservative-Lib Dem coalition is most likely. Labour voters switching to Lib Dem would put Cameron into No 10
In the Sunday Times interview, the Lib Dem leader revealed he would support the Tories
